explanation: Binds the exfiltration flow to the Wi-Fi IPv6 address (distinct network path) and sends Base64 data via ncat to a high, uncommon TCP port. This explicitly uses a different medium/interface than a likely primary wired channel, aligning with T1011.
rationale_steps: Select Wi-Fi IPv6 address to force use of a different network medium/interface.
Send Base64 data via IPv6 TCP to a non-standard high port.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced quotes/parentheses, valid cmdlets and ncat flags, and correct use of pipelines and separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command exfiltrates data via ncat over IPv6 but does not use trusted signed system scripts to proxy execution (e.g., cscript/wscript with Microsoft-signed scripts), so it is not aligned with System Script Proxy Execution.
